page.title: 01South Cadbury and surrounds
page.content: Westward the landscape is a pattern f well farmed fields with grass for dairy farming predominating. At the eastern end the land rises to the ancient hill fort known locally as Cadbury Castle but by the media and tourism as Camelot. This interesting monument brings many tourists from home and abroad to this otherwise peaceful area of farms and small villages. Tourists have little effect on village life as there are no shops or museums to cater for them. Local children have to be taken by bus to schools in their parts of Somerset as local schools are closed. There are plans to allow fare paying public to travel on these buses. South Cadbury has a new pavillion built on its playing field but activities such as the village site still take place as traditionally,
